careers.summary: Designs, builds, and maintains software systems and applications.
steps: Learn Python and Java fundamentals
Build personal or open-source projects
Intern at a tech company to gain experience
Practice technical interview questions
Apply for entry-level software engineering roles
careers.outcome: Become an entry-level software engineer skilled in full-stack development.

careers.summary: Uses data, algorithms, and statistics to generate business insights.
steps: Study statistics and data analysis concepts
Learn Python libraries like pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn
Complete projects or participate in Kaggle competitions
Intern in a data analytics or AI-related role
Apply for junior data scientist or analyst roles
careers.outcome: Work in data-driven roles applying analytical and machine learning skills.

careers.summary: Protects systems and networks from cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
steps: Learn networking and security fundamentals
Get certifications like CompTIA Security+ or CEH
Participate in Capture The Flag competitions
Gain internship experience in IT security
Apply for cybersecurity analyst positions
careers.outcome: Work in IT security, monitoring and defending networks.

careers.summary: Analyzes financial risks using mathematics, statistics, and economics.
steps: Study probability theory and financial mathematics
Pass actuarial exams (Part I and II)
Intern at an insurance or finance company
Develop Excel and data analysis skills
Apply for actuarial graduate roles
careers.outcome: Work as a certified actuary in insurance or finance sectors.

careers.summary: Transforms data into actionable insights through reports and visualization.
steps: Learn SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Tableau or Power BI)
Take an online data analysis or statistics course
Complete a small portfolio project using open data
Intern in a business or analytics role
Apply for junior data analyst positions
careers.outcome: Start a data analytics career with real-world reporting experience.

careers.summary: Uses mathematical models to inform investment strategies.
steps: Master probability, statistics, and linear algebra
Learn programming in Python or R
Study financial instruments and markets
Intern at a hedge fund or investment bank
Apply for quantitative analyst positions
careers.outcome: Work in finance, developing models to guide investment decisions.

careers.summary: Conducts experiments and studies physical phenomena.
steps: Obtain advanced degree (Masters/PhD) in Physics
Learn laboratory techniques and simulation tools
Publish research papers
Collaborate with research institutions
Apply for research scientist positions in academia or industry
careers.outcome: Lead research projects in physics and applied sciences.

careers.summary: Studies celestial bodies and the universe.
steps: Pursue degree in Physics or Astronomy
Gain experience with telescopes and observational tools
Conduct independent research
Publish findings in journals
Apply for positions at observatories or research institutions
careers.outcome: Work in academia or observatories researching celestial phenomena.

careers.summary: Analyzes economic data and trends to guide policy or business decisions.
steps: Obtain degree in Economics
Study econometrics and statistical modeling
Complete internships in government or private sector
Develop forecasting and analysis skills
Apply for economist roles in policy, research, or consulting
careers.outcome: Work as an economist advising on economic strategies.

careers.summary: Evaluates financial data to guide investments and corporate decisions.
steps: Learn accounting, finance, and Excel skills
Get CFA or related certifications
Complete internship in finance or consulting
Analyze market trends and company data
Apply for financial analyst positions
careers.outcome: Provide data-driven recommendations for investments or corporate finance.
